title: How to Boost Microphone Volume on PC or Mac

steps.title: Find and right-click the speaker icon on your taskbar.
steps.content: Find and right-click the speaker icon on your taskbar. This button is located next to the date and time information in the lower-right corner of your desktop. A menu will pop up.

steps.title: Click Recording devices on the menu.
steps.content: Click Recording devices on the menu. This will open a new window, and show a list of all the audio input hardware connected to your computer.

steps.title: Select your microphone on the Recording list.
steps.content: Select your microphone on the Recording list. Find the microphone you're using on the list here, and click on it.

steps.title: Click the Properties button.
steps.content: Click the Properties button. This button is in the lower-right corner of the Sound window. It will open your microphone's settings in a new window.

steps.title: Click the Levels tab.
steps.content: Click the Levels tab. This button is between Listen and Advanced at the top of the window.

steps.title: Drag the Microphone Boost slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the Microphone Boost slider to the right. This will boost your microphone's input volume to a higher decibel level. You can see the amount of boost you're adding in decibels (dB) to the right of the slider here.

steps.title: Click the OK button.
steps.content: Click the OK button. This will save your new microphone settings, and close the microphone window.

steps.title: Click the OK button in the Sound window.
steps.content: Click the OK button in the Sound window. This will save your new audio settings, and close the Sound window.

steps.title: Click the Apple icon on your menu bar.
steps.content: Click the Apple icon on your menu bar. This button looks like a black Apple icon in the upper-left corner of your screen. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click System Preferences on the menu.
steps.content: Click System Preferences on the menu. This will open your System Preferences in a new window.

steps.title: Click Sound in System Preferences.
steps.content: Click Sound in System Preferences. This option looks like a speaker icon on the System Preferences menu. It will open your computer's audio settings.

steps.title: Click the Input tab.
steps.content: Click the Input tab. This button is located next to Sound Effects and Output at the top of the Sound window.

steps.title: Select your microphone on the Input menu.
steps.content: Select your microphone on the Input menu. You'll see a list of all the audio input devices connected to your computer here. Find the microphone you're using, and click on its name.

steps.title: Slide the Input volume slider to the right.
steps.content: Slide the Input volume slider to the right. This will boost the selected microphone's audio input to a higher level of volume. You can now speak to your microphone, and check the Input level indicator here in order to see if your microphone's input is boosted.
